node.title: Installing Moose on a local machine
node.bodyText:
Hello Everyone
I am a beginner and wanted to learn Moose. I have a Windows laptop with a window subsystem (WSL) installed on it. I am trying to install Moose using WSL but I am getting an error. Could someone please help me to install Moose on my laptop? I have attached a pdf with command that I am following and the error. Please let me know if there are further questions.
Thank you
Best
Moose_installation_error.pdf
Gaurav

Hello
you need to follow the prompt and restart the terminal after the first step.
Please feel free to paste (between triple quotes) the output of the console here (instead of pdfs or screenshots)
Guillaume

Hello
Thank you your quick reply. I did restart my terminal and followed the commands. Below is the output
(base) garora@adts141661-lt:~$ conda config --add channels https://conda.software.inl.gov/public
Warning: 'https://conda.software.inl.gov/public' already in 'channels' list, moving to the top

When I typed the following command
**mamba create -n moose moose-tools moose-libmesh**

**Could not solve for environment specs
Encountered problems while solving:
  - nothing provides deepdiff needed by moose-tools-2022.06.16-py37h6512ce3_0
  - nothing provides libpng 1.6.37 hed695b0_2 needed by moose-libmesh-2022.05.12-build_0

The environment can't be solved, aborting the operation**

I got the error shown above.

so the libmesh you are trying to install is very old. You should see something from march.
Could you please delete the environment then try again with mamba create -n moose moose-libmesh
what does python --version return?

Hello
when I tried to remove the environment by typing the command.
mamba env remove moose
it says no env to remove and also python --version gives me """ Python 3.10.8 """.
Also typing the command mamba create -n moose moose-libmesh gives me the same error.

Hello
I got the same error.
mamba create -n moose moose-libmesh-2023.03.29
Looking for: ['moose-libmesh-2023.03.29']
pkgs/main/linux-64                                            No change
pkgs/main/noarch                                              No change
pkgs/r/linux-64                                               No change
pkgs/r/noarch                                                 No change
https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64                No change
https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/noarch                  No change
Could not solve for environment specs
Encountered problems while solving:

nothing provides requested moose-libmesh-2023.03.29

Is there any other way on install it on windows?

well on windows-windows no. On WSL this should have worked.
If you're comfortable you can try the manual installation route, or we can wait for advice from Jason
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/manual_installation_gcc.html

Yeah, I guess I would wait as I don't have much knowledge about the packages and all. If I see no reply in few days then I might give it a shot. Well, I also want to mention that I tried installing using docker but failed. Looks like I was not even able to install docker on my laptop.

Some older versions or our packages were archived. I believe the version you are listing in your PDF attachment is one such version. Also, Python 3.7 has reached EOL, so we should switch that up to 3.10.
Some of the commands I am seeing being entered are incorrect. And that is the cause for some of your errors.
Let us delete the old faulty environment and start over:
Start from base environment:
mamba deactivate
mamba activate base
Delete old faulty environment:
mamba env remove -n moose
                 ^^
missed the -n argument
Install latest moose-libmesh and force the issue, that you want Python 3.10 instead of 3.7 you seem to be getting.
mamba create -n moose moose-tools moose-libmesh python=3.10
But if you need a specific version of moose-libmesh you need to specify that version with an '=' sign:
mamba create -n moose moose-libmesh=2023.03.29
                                   ^
= sign instead of -

Hello
I was able to remove the old env but when I tried to re-install it using mamba create -n moose moose-tools moose-libmesh python=3.10. I got the same error
"""Could not solve for environment specs
Encountered problems while solving:

nothing provides deepdiff needed by moose-tools-2022.06.16-py37h6512ce3_0
nothing provides libpng 1.6.37 hed695b0_2 needed by moose-libmesh-2022.05.12-build_0""".

Adding your PDF that I had to convert to text for reference (please refrain from posting images of text if you can)
Looking for: ['moose-tools' , 'moose- libmesh' ]

pkgs/main/noarch                                              No change
pkgs/r/linux-64                                               No change
bkgs/r/noarch pkgs                                            No change
/main/linux-64                                                No change
https://conda.software.inl.gov/public/linux-64                No change
https://conda.software. inl.gov/public/noarch                 No change
Could not solve for environment specs
Encountered problems while solving:
  - nothing provides deepdiff needed by moose-tools-2022.06.16-py37h6512c3 0
  - nothing provides libpng 1.6.37 hed6950_2 needed by moose-libmesh-2022.05.12-build_O
The environment can't be solved, aborting the operation

The hash identifier for moose-tools gives it away, that the system is trying to install Python 3.7:
moose-tools-2022.06.16-py37h6512c3
                       ^^^^  (py37 = Python 3.7)

node.title: Instructions for calling GPU to run input files
node.bodyText: I know the instruction to call the CPU to run the input.i files is'mpiexec -n 6 ./cat-opt -i input. i ', I want it to run faster. What is the instruction to call the GPU to run the input file?

See #21152
We dont have a full set of instruction anywhere else

node.title: Itterative solver for a highly non-linear problem
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
I am solving a problem which is highly non-linear, and iterative solvers failed due do the convergence. Now I am running my problem with a direct solver, but at a very high computational cost. Is there any suggestion for me to use iterative solver and still get convergence?
Thanks,
Ali

Hello
How many variables?
Can you describe the physics involved?
Also could please attach the convergence logs for an iterative and a direct solver?
If you could turn on the residual prints with
[Debug]
  show_var_residual_norms = true
[]

Also are the nonlinear iterations diverging? Or the linear iterations? Using a direct solver typically mostly influences the latter
Guillaume

I can do that for future simulations. In my simulation, phase field and navier stokes are fully coupled.
 Elems:                   
    Total:                 2250
    Local:                 24
    Min/Max/Avg:           23/24/23
  Num Subdomains:          1
  Num Partitions:          94
  Partitioner:             metis

Nonlinear System:
  Num DOFs:                11780
  Num Local DOFs:          205
  Variables:               { "vel_x" "vel_y" "p" "c" "w" } 
  Finite Element Types:    "LAGRANGE" 
  Approximation Orders:    "FIRST"

Can you drop pressure to zero-th order?
In incompressible flow it acts as a Lagrange multiplier and the numbers of degrees of freedom on this are best limited

I don't actually think that zeroth order pressure is stable. Trying it out on a test problem it yields a singular matrix. If you wanted to do constant monomial for pressure you'd likely need to add discontinuous galerkin face flux terms for the mass equation.
But for the variables used here, @alimostafavi24, you do have to make sure you're using pressure stabilization if you're going to do equal order discretization with velocity. I don't know if you're already doing that?
If you want something other than LU for Navier-Stokes, you're probably going to want to explore field split options. You can look at some discussion on #22405.

node.title: Aspect Ratio Postprocessing
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
I am solving cahn-hilliard equation and I solved for the order parameter. I am not very familiar with post-processing in MOOSE. The initial condition is the elliptical domain and then the domain evolves and oscillated as it can seen in the attached image. What I need is to get the aspect ratio in each time step and plot it vs time. I would highly appreciate it if someone can tell me how I can get the aspect ratio and plot it vs time.

Thank you,
Ali
@dschwen do you have any suggestion for the kind of aspect ratio postprocessor this user is asking for? This kind of seems like it would be a nontrivial postprocessor to implement
We need some sort of "multi-quantity" postprocessor. Would have been a good base for the PressureDrop PP too

node.title: Why did the hypre parameters I modified fail to take effect？
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone! May I ask a question?
When I modify in moose
-pc_hypre_boomeramg_strong_threshold = 0.7
It outputs


But the residuals didn't change, did this step not work？
Lily

Can you try -pc_hypre_boomeramg_strong_threshold 0.7
it works fine for me

Thank you so much!
Lily

node.title: Solution Divergence
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
I have a model which perfectly converge on my desktop computer with 8 CPUs. However, it diverges when I run on HPC with 8 CPUs either! What could be the reason for that? Could it be because of PETHC?
Thanks,
Ali

could be that your problem is poorly conditioned, so the perturbation of a slightly different architecture sends it on a path of non-convergence. Or it could be something else. In order to better determine what the problem might be, it would be helpful for you to share the nonlinear and linear iteration history of the failed solve including the non-convergence reason at the end of the nonlinear solve

Time Step 0, time = 0

Postprocessor Values:
+----------------+----------------+
| time           | total_solute   |
+----------------+----------------+
|   0.000000e+00 |   0.000000e+00 |
+----------------+----------------+

and this is the block for preconditioning and executioner.
[Preconditioning]
  [./SMP_PJFNK]
    type = SMP
    full = true
    solve_type = Newton
  [../]
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -sub_pc_type -sub_pc_factor_levels'
  petsc_options_value = 'bjacobi  ilu          4'

How many degrees of freedom do you have in your problem? If you have ~1000 degrees of freedom or less, I would run with -pc_type svd -pc_svd_monitor and check your condition number. It's also helpful for debugging if you print your nonlinear and linear residuals

Hello
Does it converge in serial on either machine?
Could you please report the commit number (git log HEAD) for MOOSE on the two machines?
Could you please attach the entire output console log on the machine it does converge on?
Guillaume

Could you please tell me how should I get the got log HEAD? This is the first time I encounter this.
Thanks,
Ali
in console: git log HEAD

node.title: Access to MARMOT
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE Developer,
I would like to access MARMOT to study grain growth with Phase field and mechanical coupling model,and be instructed to contact the moose-users group. What should I do, thanks in advance!
Best,
Wei

Please go to (https://inl.gov/ncrc/) and see the "How NCRC Works" link on that page. Your institution must have a license agreement with INL in place, and all approved users must be evaluated on a case-by-case basis. On that page, there is also an email to submit a question to the NCRC for other questions you may have regarding access.
Thanks for your good instructions. I will fill in the application materials and look forward to using Marmot.

Dear cticenhour,
Thanks for your reply.I read the webpage carefully: INL Modeling and Simulation Software. I still have some doubts and hope to get your answers.@cticenhour
First, as a PhD student from a Chinese university instead of a native American university, can I get a license to use marmot?
Second, if I am eligible for a marmot license, what should I or my school pay?
Kind regards,
Wei Peng
East China University of Science and Technology
School of Mechanical and Power Engineering

As I am not a member of the access team for MARMOT or our other codes, I am not able to answer these questions. Please submit it to the form on the Access page I sent to you previously, or to the contacts on the "Access Instructions" page linked just above that form.

Most of the phase-field models including grain growth are already available in MOOSE. There are examples of phase-field and mechanics coupling in the 'combined' module. You can learn from these examples and build models around them. What do you need from MARMOT specifically?

My research direction is to study the grain growth and failure mechanism of ultra-fine or nanocrystalline under the interaction of mechanical field and temperature field. I read the article by L. Zhao.

On the plastic driving force of grain boundary migration: A fully coupled phase field and crystal plasticity model

His model is a coupled model of crystal plasticity and phase field, which is simulated by MARMOT. So, using MARMOT may be a good choice for me.
And in the combined example, only the linear elasticity is coupled into the phase field, there is no example of coupled crystal plasticity. I tried to couple j2 into the phase field last month, but failed. #16577

HI @cticenhour ,
The link you provided here for MARMOT (https://moose.inl.gov/marmot/SitePages/Access.aspx) no longer works.
Can you please provide an updated link?
Thank you very much

To ask for access to MARMOT you ll need to apply here
https://ncrcaims.inl.gov/Identity/Account/Login

Thanks @GiudGiud - I updated my post to reflect going to the NCRC home page https://inl.gov/ncrc.
@KamalnathOSU thanks to you for pointing out the broken link!

Thank you guys for your prompt response !
I want to simulate uniaxial compression of cylinder till plastic deformation (see the image below). Do you guys have any example in MOOSE that is similar to this ?

Hi Guys !
I got confused with the MARMOT(https://github.com/MAteRialMOdelingToolbox/Marmot) library  with the MARMOT application. The MARMOT which I need is actually open-source.

node.title: March 2023 Newsletter
node.bodyText:
The March 2023 MOOSE Newsletter has been released! A summary of the content is below:

MOOSE Improvements

Customized userobject / postprocessor execution order


libMesh-level Changes

2023.03.02 Update: Change Notes
2023.03.29 Update: Change Notes


Packaged VTK (moose-libmesh-vtk) updated to 9.2.6
Various bug fixes and enhancements

VectorPostprocessor parallel bug identified by ANL researchers was fixed through improved default synchronization.

node.title: How to use geometric multigrid preprocessing(mg)？
node.bodyText:
Hello, everyone! May I ask a question?
When I use mg, it seems that geometric information cannot be applied, only one layer can be applied. Could you please tell me whether multiple layers of mg can be used？
Thanks!
Lily

Hello
How are you using geometric multigrid from MOOSE?
Guillaume

I do this by using the option -pc_type mg.
Lily

We do not have handles for true geometric multigrid in MOOSE at this time, although I know it is on @roystgnr's wish-list. You can see some geometric multigrid at the libMesh level in libMesh/libmesh#2047

Thanks a lot!
Lily

node.title: Impose a dirichlet boundary condition on one component of a vertor variable and ignore the other components
node.bodyText:
hello，I want impose a dirichlet boundary condition on only one component of a vertor variable and ignore the other components. Is there any built-in boundary conditions that can be used in moose?
It seems that DirichletBC can impose dirichlet doundary condition on a scalar variable, and VectorDirichletBC can deal with vector variables but cannot pick a specific component.
Thanks for your help！

I think, the AD version of VectorNodalBC as ADVectorDirichletBC and ADVectorFunctionDirichletBC has params: set_x_comp, set_y_comp, set_z_comp. To ignore one or two components of the vector, just set those parameter to false.
Thanks for your reply. I found these parameters in ADVectorMatchedValueBC.
Yes，ADVectorFunctionDirichletBC works well for my issue, thank you
